pt: {sc}faithful{/sc} {sc}loyal{/sc} {sc}constant{/sc} {sc}staunch{/sc} {sc}steadfast{/sc} {sc}resolute{/sc} mean firm in adherence to whatever one owes allegiance. {sc}faithful{/sc} implies unswerving adherence to a person or thing or to the oath or promise by which a tie was contracted.
{sc}loyal{/sc} implies a firm resistance to any temptation to desert or betray.
{sc}constant{/sc} stresses continuing firmness of emotional attachment without necessarily implying strict obedience to promises or vows.
{sc}staunch{/sc} suggests fortitude and resolution in adherence and imperviousness to influences that would weaken it.
{sc}steadfast{/sc} implies a steady and unwavering course in love, allegiance, or conviction.
{sc}resolute{/sc} implies firm determination to adhere to a cause or purpose.

et: Middle English {it}stedefast{/it}, from Old English {it}stedefæst{/it}, from {it}stede{/it} + {it}fæst{/it} fixed, fast
shortdef: firm in belief, determination, or adherence : loyal
